definitions.definition: A tightly-packed and disorderly crowd of people .
examples: A scrum developed around the bar when free beer was announced.

definitions.definition: ( Canada ) A tightly packed group of reporters surrounding a person, usually a politician, asking for comments about an issue; an opportunity provided for a politician to be approached this way.
examples: A scrum formed around Scott Brison in the House of Commons lobby shortly after he announced his candidacy for the federal Liberal leadership.

definitions.definition: ( rugby ) In rugby union or rugby league, all the forwards joined together in an organised way.

( software engineering ) In Agile software development (specifically Scrum or related methodologies), a daily meeting in which each developer describes what they have been doing, what they plan to do next, and any impediments to progress.

main_definition: A tightly-packed and disorderly crowd of people .

main_definition: ( software engineering ) Alternative letter-case form of Scrum .
